  • About Me

Robert Casey Lafferty

I am a recent graduate of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln where I received my master's degree in Computer Science researching educational video games. I also have a Bachelor's of Science in Computer Science from Kansas State University, where I focused my studies on cyber security and video game development.

My interests include software development, game development, cyber security, artificial intelligence, web development, and more.

Wooded (Unity C#)

Wooded was created at the Kansas State University Annual Game Jam in February 2019 based on the theme "Left Behind." I worked alongside two other team members to develop this game with my primary roles including level design, UI design, event scripting, tilemap, and some art using Photoshop. This game features original art and original music, as everything in the game was created from scratch.

GitHub Link:
https://github.com/UNL-Game-Dev-Club/Wooded/

Play on Itch.io:
https://rclafferty.itch.io/Wooded

Roles:
Level design, gameplay design, storyboarding, UI design, event scripting, tilemap, title screen art

Platform Support:
Windows 10

Controls:
Mouse left click to choose options, Arrow Keys or WASD to move, optional controller input

Requires Admin Privileges:
No

Actively Developing:
No

What have I learned from this project?

I learned how to use Photoshop for developing the title screen text art ("Wooded", "Start", and "Quit"). I also learned about tilemaps and how to use them to implement the maze and the forest.
